title: Ziwaphi
text:
Ziwaphi is an investigative and a general interest, biweekly, <a href="Tabloid%20%28paper%20size%29">tabloid-size</a> <a href="newspaper">newspaper</a>, with an estimated 40,000 readers. It was started with funding from the <a href="Media%20Development%20and%20Diversity%20Agency">Media Development and Diversity Agency</a> (MDDA). The MDDA is an agency that was established by the <a href="South%20African%20government">South African government</a> to redress the exclusion and marginalisation of victims of <a href="apartheid">apartheid</a> policies from access to the media and the <a href="media%20industry">media industry</a>, <a href="media%20ownership">media ownership</a> and control.
The name "Ziwaphi" is a colloquial <a href="Nguni%20people">Nguni</a> expression, which means "What’s Happening and Where?" – these are the two of the five most important questions when gathering news in <a href="Five%20Ws">journalism</a>. The newspaper is the brainchild of Tom Nkosi, a <a href="public%20relations">public relations</a> graduate from the <a href="University%20of%20South%20Africa">University of South Africa</a> who also received his journalism training at the <a href="Singapore%20Press%20Holdings">Singapore Press Holdings</a>.
Ziwaphi is based in <a href="Mbombela">Mbombela</a>, the capital city of <a href="Mpumalanga%20Province">Mpumalanga Province</a>, one of <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>'s nine provinces. It specialises in local and regional news coverage, but also offers a broad range provincial and national news. Along with news, lifestyle, sports, and commentary, the newspaper also features a full complement of display and <a href="classified%20advertising">classified advertising</a>.
The content of the newspaper is generated by a team of experienced journalists, <a href="Volunteering">volunteer</a>s, high-profile commentators and specialists on a variety of subjects, such as <a href="gender">gender</a> issues; <a href="HIV">HIV</a> and <a href="AIDS">AIDS</a>; <a href="economy">economy</a>; <a href="law">law</a> and <a href="politics">politics</a>. It is published by Uxhumano Communications and carries articles by various commentators, news-makers, political and economic analysts, as well as in-depth interviews with influential individuals, leaders and policy makers.
The first edition hit the streets on 13 April 2007, and ever since, the publication is growing strong with an estimated 8,000 editions printed every month. The newspaper is accredited by the Audit Bureau of Circulations of South Africa. It is distributed every second Friday of the month in the three municipalities, <a href="Mbombela%20Local%20Municipality">Mbombela</a>, <a href="Nkomazi%20Local%20Municipality">Nkomazi</a> and <a href="Umjindi%20Local%20Municipality">Umjindi</a> in the <a href="Ehlanzeni%20District%20Municipality">Ehlanzeni District</a> of Mpumalaga Province.
The newspaper is a member of the <a href="Association%20of%20Independent%20Publishers">Association of Independent Publishers</a> (AIP), southern Africa's largest umbrella body for independent grassroots and advocacy publications.
